text.0: full many songs have met in thee o indra and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth.
text.1: now and of old the eulogies of sages their holy hymns and lauds have yearned for indra.
text.2: he praised of many bold invoked of many alone is glorified at sacrifices.
text.3: like a car harnessed for some great achievement indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.
text.4: they make their way to indra and exalt him bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble.
text.5: for when a hundred or a thousand singers laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.
text.6: as brightness mingles with the moon in heaven the offered soma yearns to mix with indra.
text.7: like water brought to men in desert places our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.
text.8: to him this mighty eulogy to indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets.
text.9: that in the great encounter with the foemen loved of all life indra may guard and help us.
